com.tractrac.model.lib.api.route

Interface IControlPoint

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPropertiesContainer, com.tractrac.util.lib.api.serialize.ISerializable

    public interface IControlPoint
extends com.tractrac.util.lib.api.serialize.ISerializable, IPropertiesContainer

    It represents any of the physical control points used in a logical control (IControl).

    A control point can be static or dynamic. A static control point does not move in time, but stays at the same position. A dynamic control point can move in time.

    Example of dynamic control points are buoys used in sailing events. Example of static control points are waypoints/controls in adventure races/orienteering.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.util.UUID getId()
        Gets the control point id. There are two different behaviours:
        • The control point is part of a line: Its value is initialized with the values of P1.UUID/P2.UUID metadata entries of the IControl that contains it. In case this properties are not defined it will be initialized to null.
        • The control point is part of a single mark: It has the same value than the IControl.getId() that contains it.
        Returns:
        Control point Id.

      • getPosition

        @Deprecated
IPosition getPosition()
        Deprecated. the position for a control has to be retrieved using the subscription library
        Gets the position of a control point. If the control is dynamic, it will send the latest known position
        Returns:
        the position of the control

      • isStatic

        boolean isStatic()
        Flag specifying whether the control point is static or dynamic.
        Returns:
        true if the control is static.
